result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin P Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis
Court advised defendasnt that he cannot possess firearms or body armor,he must provide DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  
Pay restititution of $650.00 to Joshua K. Joint and several.
DOC to collect monetary  sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  ALL to be paid by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin P Johnson

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Decision and order denying request for reconsideration of CIP and/or WSAP eligibility.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. spc

Defendant's pro se request for reconsideration of his eligibility for CIP or WSAP.  

(return address: Marvin Johnson #632925, RYOCF, PO Box 2500, Racine, WI 53404)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to defendant's request.
Pro se letter from defendant.
Original SENTENCING Transcript (45 pages) commencing JULY 29, 2015 received and filed. kl
Restitution Worksheet and Victim/Witness Impact statement received and filed./ds

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  No corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 60 months with 331 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 36 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 24 months; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection; pay restituion of $650 to Joshua K. - joint and several - by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.   

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment; 4) no illegally controlled substances or alcohol; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment; 7) cognitive intervention programs.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Sentencing Report submitted by defense, filed.
Character letters (x3) and defendant letter, filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to amended Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders a presentence investigation and defense will have a private presentence investigation performed.   Court cancels the jury trial.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS Count 1 to Attempted Robbery (Use of Force) PTAC 943.32(1)(a), 939.32, 939.05 a Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Amended Information received and filed./ds
State's Witness List received and filed./ds
State's Motion in Limine received and filed./ds
State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
Attorneys have spoken and the motion hearing is not needed.  Case removed from the calendar for motions.  Case remains set for final pretrial on 6-18-15./ds

ADA Grant Huebner would like to proceed with the hearing.  Clerk called Attorney Rosenthal and left message on his voice mail that he should call ADA Huebner and he may have to appear this afternoon.  Email was sent to ADA Huebner stating the hearing will be held in the afternoon./ds

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo for Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

No motions have been filed on this case.  Case remains set for the final pretrial date.
FILED, MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BRIEFING SCHEDULE
Notice of Alibi received and filed./ds

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has further information to provide to defense, but case can be set for jury trial.  State has an Other Acts Motion.  Court orders briefs due on 5-8-15.  State has other jury trials set on the day of trial.  Court sets ths case as a backup.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has discovery.  State will follow up on information that was provided.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

ADA Huebner has a medical emergency and cannot appear this morning.  Defense requests an adjournment for further ivestigation.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Marvin P Johnson not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery today and needs time to review with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty to all counts.  Court advises the defendant on charges and penalties.   Defense has not received all the discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Arraignment scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Joshua K.; Matthew C.; Rachel c. or Joanna L.
Amended Complaint received and filed.  All charges remain the same

Defendant Marvin P Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Marvin P Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
